questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important objective of embedding risk management practices into the initiation phase of the project management life cycle?

discussion.content: Possible be A. An increase in the number of infrastructure changes? When there's increase number of infra changes, pentest can be use to justify if there's any vulnerabilities.

Selected Answer: A
A. Similar question is in ISACA Q&A.

Selected Answer: A
Agree it is A. When the environment changes, pen tests find new issues introduced by these changes. This is a component of compliance standards so makes sense ISACA would test to that.
I am going with B. its more direct.

Selected Answer: A
The MOST significant indicator of the need to perform a penetration test is typically the presence of a significant change or upgrade to an organization's infrastructure or software. This could include things like the deployment of a new system or application, a major upgrade to an existing system or application, or the integration of multiple systems or applications.
Yes, will go with A. Pentest is done after significant infra changes.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST significant indicator of the need to perform a penetration test?

choices.B: An increase in the number of security incidents
choices.A: An increase in the number of infrastructure changes
choices.C: An increase in the number of high-risk audit findings
choices.D: An increase in the percentage of turnover in IT personnel

discussion.content: I think C. There's a question in the QAE similar to this. I forgot what specific number. But the explanation says that penetration test reflects real-life attack that's why it's a better test to determine whether controls in place are effective.

Selected Answer: D
It is either B or D. The problem word is "appropriate". Audit says they have controls according to the audit criteria. Risk assessment says the following situations need to be addressed and includes evaluating the existing controls.
Telling you its B

Selected Answer: B
Correction, reason:
During an information system audit, auditors review and test the effectiveness of IT controls to ensure they are operating as intended and that they are adequate to manage the risks faced by the organization. This enables auditors to identify weaknesses in IT controls and provide recommendations to address any deficiencies.

In contrast, an IT risk assessment may not provide the same level of detail or depth as an information system audit. IT risk assessments may only focus on high-level risks and may not provide a comprehensive assessment of an organization's IT controls.

Selected Answer: D
To ensure a newly acquired company has appropriate IT controls in place, the MOST reliable information would be obtained through a comprehensive IT security assessment or audit.
